application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Erection of a rear mansard roof extension with two rear roof dormers and one obscured window to the flank wall, replacement of roof lantern with flat roof light, construction of a 1.8m high brick wall to boundary with 50, continuation of parapet to north west elevation of roof terrace, new railings and installation of condenser unit to roof terrace within timber enclosure following the demolition of two rear dormers
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Design & access statement, Heritage statement, A/C specification, 001, EX02, PL01 & PL02; Received: 12/11/2021; fire statement & EX01 Received: 03/12/2021; Noise assessment Received: 01/02/2022) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 4 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 5 - The windows formed in the side elevation shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.

Condition : 6 - Within 28 days of completion of the installation of air conditioning unit and acoustic enclosure hereby approved, a post completion noise assessment shall be submitted for approval to the local planning authority which demonstrates the actual measured rating level of plant operating under normal conditions. All measurements shall be made in accordance with the methodology of BS4142: 2014 (Methods for rating and assessing industrial and commercial sound) and/or its subsequent amendments. 

The plant shall be isolated on adequate proprietary anti-vibration mounts to prevent the structural transmission of vibration and regenerated noise within adjacent or adjoining premises, and these shall be so maintained thereafter.

The air conditioning unit hereby permitted shall not be used prior to the installation of permanent acoustic enclosures around as stated within the submitted Noise Impact Assessment and level of noise emitted shall be 10dB(A) below the existing background noise level at all times that the unit operates.
